intro: Galium iltisii, commonly known as the Iltis' bedstraw, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing herbaceous plant characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Galium iltisii is native to specific regions in the western United States, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a unique and relatively rare member of the bedstraw genus.
